text:
Pulcheria Alexandrovna fidgeted. 

“I’m worried about one thing,” she said.

Dounia nodded. 

“Go on, mother,” she urged.

Pulcheria took a breath. 

“This morning, we received a note from Pyotr Petrovitch. He promised to meet us at the station. Instead, he sent a servant with an address.”

Dounia frowned.

“He’s not coming?” 

Pulcheria shook her head. 

“He sent a message. But there’s something in the note that troubles me. Dmitri Prokofitch, please read it.”

Razumihin opened the note. 

“Dear Madam…” he read aloud. 

Pulcheria waited, anxious. 

“What do you think?” she asked. 

Dounia looked at Dmitri, uncertain.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Pulcheria Alexandrovna expresses her worry about Pyotr Petrovitch's unexpected change of plans regarding their meeting.
